document_title: Painful urination: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: tieu-buot.json_2_Symptoms of painful urination are common
subsection_content:
Painful urination has typical symptoms such as a burning sensation and discomfort when going to the toilet. Patients should not ignore it to avoid more serious complications. If the patient has painful urination and the following symptoms, go to a medical facility immediately:
Sharp pain that lasts more than 24 hours; Pain accompanied by fever; Vaginal secretions; Urine has a strange smell, is mixed with blood or is cloudy; Painful urination accompanied by abdominal pain; Have bladder diseases or kidney stones; Pain in the hips or back
subsection_title: tieu buot.json. Symptoms of painful urination are common
